nodes.text: The term standard month, also known more simply as month, referred to a period of time that lasted, in the Galactic Standard Calendar, approximately 30 days, though it differed between the twelve months of a standard year. The Invasion of Naboo lasted for one month. The lifespans of people, especially infants, would occasionally be measured in months instead of years. In some forms of the calendar, a month was measured by 35 days (7 weeks of 5 days).
